function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Risk of uncertainty in viral load associated with different aerosol sizes","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of transmission via surface contacts and fomites","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of sars-cov-2 through surface contacts and fomites","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survival of viruses on surfaces for extended periods of time","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quantifying the risk associated with fomite pathway","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effectiveness of specific disinfectants on coronaviruses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Soap and water alone may not be effective at deactivating the virus on surfaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sodium laureth sulfate in soaps may cause irritation and is not suitable for sensitive skin","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of droplet behavior and propagation in the built environment may lead to incorrect social distancing rules.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on simplified models and assumptions may result in inaccurate assessment of social distancing requirements.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for directionality of respiratory events in layout design","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate social distancing recommendations based on assumptions about droplet behavior","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient emphasis on ventilation and air quality in reducing airborne transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate use of face masks and coverings leading to increased transmission of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate use or non-use of face masks in public spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of enforcement of face mask regulations","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient adoption of face mask use","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate wearing of face masks and coverings in areas with known or suspected community transmission of covid-19 virus","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the effectiveness of cloth-based face masks in reducing the emission of particles","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate integration of face masks and coverings with other preventive measures such as social distancing and hand hygiene","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective face coverings and masks may lead to high outward particle emission rates during speaking and coughing, increasing the risk of virus-laden aerosols and droplets transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient use of face shields for blocking transmission of cough-generated aerosol particles, leading to increased risk of virus transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imperfect fit and adherence of masks leading to decreased viral exposure","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient filtration of household materials used for masks and coverings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The use of face shields as an alternative to face masks may not effectively prevent the transmission of airborne particles and aerosols, leading to potential exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covering the face with masks or face shields negatively impacts the ability of hard of hearing hoh individuals to listen and lip-read, affecting approximately 11 million people in the uk.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encouraging the use of face masks and coverings as a precautionary measure to mitigate the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation leading to high airborne infection risk","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate source reduction and management of indoor events","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of the effectiveness of masks in reducing transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate purging of rooms between events leading to higher concentration of virus-laden particles","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for airborne transmission of covid-19 due to inadequate purging and ventilation in enclosed spaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disturbance of air and dispersal of airborne aerosols due to movement of people within enclosed spaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Highly turbulent wake with a reynolds number of about 10^5 in spaces with high people density and movement.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"A cloud of infected aerosol may be mixed by the wakes of many people in spaces like supermarkets, increasing the risk of exposure to subsequent individuals.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The settling time of small aerosols being comparable to ventilation timescales, leading to prolonged exposure to aerosols in indoor spaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Laboratory simulations of aerosol dispersion in a fluid-filled channel may assist in modeling contagious disease spread in built environments.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The dispersal of contagious aerosol in buildings may lead to significant airborne transmission of diseases due to people movement, affecting individuals in the built environment.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High risk of exposure to small aerosols due to the movement of people in buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Residence time of small aerosols leading to prolonged exposure","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to increased residence time of small aerosols","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conflict between reducing airborne infection risk and maintaining thermal comfort and reducing energy consumption during colder periods.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenging to quantify occupants’ exposure to airborne virus particles, leading to difficulty in estimating the likelihood of airborne infection.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Most studies of airborne infection for covid-19 have generated risk estimates based on the wells-riley approach, which may not fully account for the complexity of dose-response models.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown presence and location of infectious occupants within indoor spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of ventilation rates leading to assumption of adequate outdoor air supply","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on co2 data for inferring the risk of airborne infection","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainties in values for quanta generation rate and viral load","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of a novel disease with limited data and experience","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quanta generation rate for airborne infection.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
